body.p: Based on survey results, the proportion of U.S. adults who own at least one Apple product (iphone, ipad, macbook, etc) is 0.42. This point estimate would be unbiased and most accurate if the survey were based on which of the following?

input.choice: A random sample of 1,000 U.S. adults
A random sample of 1,800 U.S. adults
A random sample of 2,500 U.S. college students
An internet survey posted on TechGuru.com with 3,100 responses

response.feedback: Incorrect. While it is true that this estimate is based on a random sample and would therefore be unbiased, recall that the larger the sample the estimate is based on the more accurate the estimate is.
Correct. The estimate is based on a random sample (and is therefore unbiased) and is also based on a larger sample, which makes it more accurate.

Incorrect. Although the larger sample will yield the most accurate results, the random sample consisted of only college students (who are probably more likely to own Apple products), our point estimate is likely to overestimate the true proportion.

Incorrect. Although the larger sample will yield the most accurate results, the estimate is based on a voluntary response survey which is biased because the population will not represent all U.S. adults. A random sample will produce unbiased results.

body.p: Based on survey results, the mean amount of credit card debt for U.S. adults under 35 is $8,724. This point estimate would be unbiased and most accurate if the survey were based on which of the following?

input.choice: A random sample of 1,500 U.S. adults under 35
A random sample of 2,800 U.S. adults under 35
A random sample of 3,000 U.S. college students
A national television news station poll with 3,500 responses

response.feedback: Incorrect. While it is true that this estimate is based on a random sample and would therefore be unbiased, recall that the larger the sample the estimate is based on the more accurate the estimate is.
Correct. The estimate is based on a random sample (and is therefore unbiased) and is also based on a larger sample, which makes it more accurate.

Incorrect. Although the larger sample will yield the most accurate results, the random sample consisted of only college students (who may have more credit card debt than other adults under age 35), our point estimate is likely to overestimate the true proportion.

Incorrect. Although the larger sample will yield the most accurate results, the estimate is based on a voluntary response poll which is biased because the population will not represent all U.S. adults under 35. A random sample will produce unbiased results.
